articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. rejoins UNESCO: "It's a historic moment!"
articles.description: Trump pulled the U.S. out of the U.N. agency. Here's why the Biden administration believes America "can't afford to be absent any longer."
articles.content:
United Nations — It's official. The United States on Tuesday became the 194th member nation of the U.N.'s education, science and culture agency, or UNESCO. It was, of course, a formality, after the agency's board welcomed back the U.S. in late June.

The Justice Department on Tuesday said that Donald Trump can be held personally liable for remarks he made about a woman who accused him of rape – a reversal of its position that Trump was protected because he was president when he made the remarks.
